items.title: Gemini API I/O updates
items.content: <article>Announcing new features and models for the Gemini API, with the introduction of Gemini 2.5 Flash Preview with improved reasoning and efficiency, Gemini 2.5 Pro and Flash text-to-speech supporting multiple languages and speakers, and Gemini 2.5 Flash native audio dialog for conversational AI.</article>

items.title: Explore the latest updates on Google Wallet
items.content: <article>Google Wallet has expanded globally and introduced new features like digital IDs via a new Digital Credentials API, granular notifications for pass updates, and nearby pass notifications, along with other features like Value Added Opportunities and a Pass Upgrade experience.</article>

items.title: Bringing Gemini intelligence to Google Home APIs
items.content: <article>Gemini intelligence is being integrated into Google Home APIs, offering developers access to over 750 million devices and enabling advanced features like AI-powered camera analysis and automated routines.</article>

items.title: Data-driven marketing starts with developers
items.content: <article>Three developer-friendly MarTech solutions – sGTM Pantheon for data control, GA4 Dataform for data transformation, and FeedX for A/B testing shopping feeds – empower developers to leverage marketing data for insights, strategies, and better results.</article>

items.title: Exploring the Magic Mirror: an interactive experience powered by the Gemini models
items.content: <article>The Magic Mirror project utilizes the Gemini API, including the Live API, Function Calling, and Grounding with Google Search, to create an interactive and dynamic experience,  demonstrating the power of the Gemini models to generate visuals, tell stories, and provide real-time information through a familiar object.</article>

items.title: An upgraded dev experience in Google AI Studio
items.content: <article>Google AI Studio has been upgraded to enhance the developer experience, featuring native code generation with Gemini 2.5 Pro, agentic tools, and enhanced multimodal generation capabilities, plus  new features like the Build tab, Live API, and improved tools for building sophisticated AI applications.</article>

items.title: New Google Pay features to enhance your payment flows
items.content: <article>At Google I/O 2025, new Google Pay API updates were unveiled to enhance checkout experiences with features like Android WebViews integration, a more versatile API, and improved developer tools.</article>

items.title: Adding support for Google Pay within Android WebView
items.content: <article>Google Pay support within Android WebView is now available, starting with WebView version 137 and Play Services 25.18.30, allowing users to utilize the native Google Pay payment sheet within embedded web checkout processes.</article>

items.title: Gemini Code Assist in Apigee API Management now generally available
items.content: <article>Gemini Code Assist in Apigee API Management enhances API development with AI-assisted features like natural language API creation, AI-generated summaries, and iterative design, allowing seamless integration with your organization's existing API ecosystem and ensuring consistency, security, and reduced duplication, while offering enterprise-grade security and a streamlined development workflow.</article>

items.title: What you should know from the Google I/O 2025 Developer keynote
items.content: <article>Top announcements from Google I/O 2025 focus on building across Google platforms and innovating with AI models from Google DeepMind, with key focus on new tools, APIs, and features designed to enhance developer productivity and create AI-powered experiences using Gemini, Android, Firebase, and web.</article>

items.title: On-device small language models with multimodality, RAG, and Function Calling
items.content: <article>Google AI Edge advancements, include new Gemma 3 models, broader model support, and features like on-device RAG and Function Calling to enhance on-device generative AI capabilities.</article>

items.title: Fully Reimagined: AI-First Google Colab
items.content: <article>Google Colab is launching a reimagined AI-first version at Google I/O, featuring an agentic collaborator powered by Gemini 2.5 Flash with iterative querying capabilities, an upgraded Data Science Agent, effortless code transformation, and flexible interaction methods, aiming to significantly improve coding workflows.</article>

items.title: What's new with Agents: ADK, Agent Engine, and A2A Enhancements
items.content: <article>Updates to Google's agent technologies include the Agent Development Kit (ADK) with new Python and Java versions, an improved Agent Engine UI for management, and enhancements to the Agent2Agent (A2A) protocol for better agent communication and security.</article>

items.title: From idea to app: Introducing Stitch, a new way to design UIs
items.content: <article>Stitch, a new Google Labs experiment, uses AI to generate UI designs and frontend code from text prompts and images, aiming to streamline the design and development workflow, offering features like UI generation from natural language or images, rapid iteration, and seamless paste to Figma and front-end code.</article>

items.title: LiteRT: Maximum performance, simplified
items.content: <article>LiteRT has been improved to boost AI model performance and efficiency on mobile devices by effectively utilizing GPUs and NPUs, now requiring significantly less code, enabling simplified hardware accelerator selection, and more for optimal on-device performance.</article>

items.title: Building agents with Google Gemini and open source frameworks
items.content: <article>Google Gemini models offer several advantages when building AI agents, such as advanced reasoning, function calling, multimodality, and large context window capabilities. Open-source frameworks like LangGraph, CrewAI, LlamaIndex, and Composio can be used with Gemini for agent development.</article>

items.title: Announcing Gemma 3n preview: powerful, efficient, mobile-first AI
items.content: <article>Gemma 3n is a cutting-edge open model designed for fast, multimodal AI on devices, featuring optimized performance, unique flexibility with a 2-in-1 model, and expanded multimodal understanding with audio, empowering developers to build live, interactive applications and sophisticated audio-centric experiences.</article>

items.title: Build and train a recommender system in 10 minutes using Keras and JAX
items.content: <article>Keras Recommenders (KerasRS) is a new library announced to help developers build recommendation systems using APIs with building blocks for ranking and retrieval, and it can be installed via pip with support for JAX, TensorFlow, or PyTorch backends.</article>

items.title: Google Pay inside sandboxed iframe for PCI DSS v4 compliance
items.content: <article>Use a sandboxed iframe to implement Google Pay on checkout pages, which helps comply with PCI DSS v4 requirements by isolating scripts. Shopify successfully implemented this method and passed the PCI DSS v4 audit.</article>

items.title: Gemini 2.5: Updates to our family of thinking models
items.content: <article>Google is releasing updates to its Gemini 2.5 model family, including the generally available and stable Gemini 2.5 Pro and Flash, and the new Gemini 2.5 Flash-Lite "thinking models" in preview, offering enhanced performance and accuracy, with Flash-Lite providing a lower-cost option.</article>

items.title: Google Cloud announces general availability of APIM Operator for Apigee
items.content: <article>The Apigee APIM Operator is now generally available, bringing API Management and Gateway capabilities to GKE environments using Kubernetes-like YAML configuration, providing developer-native tooling, reducing friction, and offering policy management comparable to Apigee Hybrid.</article>
